title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 April 2014 - XWiki
content:
<sburjan> has quit  
00:36 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
08:03 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:14 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:53 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:39 <fcharton> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <spu7nic> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <Emenems> has quit  
11:48 <Denis> has quit  
12:00 <Emenems> has joined #xwiki  
12:22 <sbaloul> has joined #xwiki  
12:30 <ClemensR> anyone tried to get the GWT debugging running lately like explained in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WYSIWYG+Editor+Module#HDebugging  ?  
12:46 <sbaloul2> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <sbaloul> has quit  
12:57 <polx> has quit  
13:21 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, are you aware of apidocs inaccessibility? ( http://maven.xwiki.org/site/xwiki-core-parent/xwiki-core/apidocs/com/xpn/xwiki/api/Document.html )  
13:22 <evalica> has quit  
13:25 <ClemensR> I guess that is because platform did not build - should be back soon (I  hope)  
13:29 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:48 <ClemensR> I see adding a new input widget in the macro editor dialog is not possible due to GWT constraints, but is there any hope to get an event handler hooked in that might transform a "normal" input field into something with e.g. autocompletion ?  
13:58 <tmortagne> that's weird http://maven.xwiki.org/site/xwiki-core-parent/xwiki-core/apidocs/com/xpn/xwiki/api/Document.html does not looks like the right API  
13:59 <tmortagne> the API reference navigator is supposed to look at maven.xwiki.org/site/docs/ AFAIK  
13:59 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: from where did you get this URL  
13:59 <tmortagne> AFAIK this is vey old try of maven site plugin that have not been updated in years  
14:00 <tmortagne> you should look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/SRD/Navigation?xpage=embed instead (we really need to update it btw)  
14:03 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: for example platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting  
14:04 <DarkKnightCZ> and thanks for the SRD  
14:04 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting is very wrong then, updating it  
14:05 <DarkKnightCZ> great :)  
14:05 <sbaloul2> has quit  
14:05 <tmortagne> the best especially for Velocity is usually the SRD since you have the velocity syntax to call each service  
14:05 <cjd> oh yeah, IIRC I set Scripting to use maven/site way back when maven/site was up to date because it has links into the private API :)  
14:08 <tmortagne> we don't really have any javadoc generated for snapshot anymore, I should probably put a link to the SRD instead of a link of the direct link on all those objects  
14:08 <tmortagne> make more sense anyway since there is not much chance someone reading that documentation is working on SNAPSHOT  
14:09 <cjd> I think we stopped building maven/site because it used up all memory ever and crashed  
14:10 <tmortagne> IMO generating this site for SNAPSHOT was not very usefull anyway  
14:11 <cjd> yeah  
14:12 <cjd> it tool like 8 hours last time it ran too  
14:13 <tmortagne> done  
14:13 <tmortagne> but what we need to improve is having a more accurate SRD, like automaticlally updated as part of the release process  
14:14 <tmortagne> since it's not fully up to date right now for example  
14:40 <spu7nic> Hi there :)  
15:00 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: hi, after updating multiple subwikis via distribution wizard, i thought of "Continue for all" feature for extensions... does anything like that exists? (or "update as previous" for subwikis -> you migrate one subwiki and all other subwikis gets updated with same params as the first one)... it gets annoying when you have to click for an hour to "continue" :)  
15:01 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: there is no feature like that no  
15:13 <DarkKnightCZ> ok then, i guess i will try to implement it this week :)  
15:14 <tmortagne> ok great, if you have question about DW UI the best is generally to ask mflorea  
15:15 <DarkKnightCZ> ok great... i will look into on thursday, got to go  
15:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has left #xwiki  
15:16 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <woshilapin> has quit  
15:22 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
15:23 <woshilapin> Hi devs, I'm looking for a way to intercept creation, save and deletion of a document  
15:23 <woshilapin> I Looked into the Javascript events but only found actions:save  
15:24 <woshilapin> (I may have missed something?)  
15:24 <woshilapin> I also saw the ActivityEventType.java file which seems to have interesting things but have no idea how I could use it  
15:30 <ClemensR> woshilapin: I guess you want to do that server side, via Observer .... me looking for the docs  
15:31 <ClemensR> something like that:  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/GroovyNotificationTutorial  
15:32 <tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Observation+Module+Local  
15:33 <woshilapin> Nice, both, probably what I need.  I will read it. Thanks  
16:03 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
16:06 <msmeria> has quit  
16:10 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
16:50 <gdelhumeau> woshilapin: you might be interrested by http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Self-Renaming+Forms  
17:03 <polx> has quit  
17:03 <cjd> haha without knowing anything about them, they sound like something that hides from you when you try to access it xD  
17:04 <cjd> ``I had a self-renaming file but I'm not sure where it is''  
17:06 <spu7nic> When it comes to http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/GroovyNotificationTutorial - what has to be changed to comply with the current best practices? :)  
17:10 <spu7nic> has left #xwiki  
17:13 <polx> has joined #xwiki
